intro: Dasystachys decorata, commonly known as the ornate sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often pale green or brown. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and water features.
